items.todoItem: Know that in the past we were physically alive but spiritually dead.
Know that in the past, not only did we sin but we sinned willfully.
Know that God has made us alive spiritually who were once spiritually dead in trespasses and sins.
Know that our former life was influenced and guided by the standards of this world.
Know that Satan is the one behind the standards of this world.
Know that Satan is currently the ruler of this world.
Know that Satan is the spirit now working in the children of disobedience who are unbelieving, obstinate and rebellious to the will of God.
Know that we were all once children of disobedience living to fulfil the desires of the flesh and of the mind.
Know that we are all born with a sinful, fallen nature.
Know that in the past it was our nature to live just like others who are worthy of the wrath of God.
Know that God is rich in mercy.
Know that God’s unconditional love for us is great.
Know that God loves us whether we reciprocate or not.
Know that God’s mercy flows from love.
Know that God’s love for us is not prompted by some lovable characteristics in us but by His nature of love.
Know that God demonstrated His great love for us even when we were spiritually dead in sins.
Know that God has every right to condemn men because of their sin but instead of executing that wrath, He extends mercy that comes from His love.
Know that God does not give tit-for-tat.
Know that God does not withhold His mercy from us even though we are victims of our own poor choices.
Know that Jesus came to bring the dead back to life.
Know that man is utterly incapable of rousing himself from spiritual death.
Know that God has made us alive together with Christ.
Know that we have been saved by God’s grace.
Know that but for God’s love, mercy and grace, we would still be dead in tresspasses and sins.
Know that we have been raised by God from the dead together with Christ.
Know that God has reserved a place for us in heaven in Christ and sees us seated together with Christ.
Know that in future generations God will show the immense and incomparable riches of His grace in His kindness to us through Christ Jesus.
Know that God is kind.
Know that God’s grace is the provision of Christ to suffer and sacrifice Himself for our sins.
Know that by God’s grace we have been saved through faith.
Know that God gives gifts to men that are undeserved.
Know that our salvation was not earned by any good works that we have done.
Know that salvation can never be earned through good works so no man could ever boast of such.
Know that salvation comes from God, not man.
Know that because God did not save us by good works, we cannot lose our salvation by bad works.
Know that we are the product of God’s own hands.
Know that we were created in Christ Jesus for good works that God preordained us to perform.
Know that in Christ we are not in competition with one another.
Take comfort in knowing that God has a unique plan for His good works in your life.
Remember that in the past we were Gentiles and lived according to the lusts of the flesh.
Remember that in the past, as Gentiles in the flesh, we were called "Uncircumcision" and despised by the Jews.
Remember that once we were without Christ.
Remember that once we were alienated from the commonwealth of Israel.
Remember that once we were strangers from the covenants of promise.
Remember that once we were without hope.
Remember that once we were far from God and without God in the world.
Know that we, who were once far from God, are brought near to God by the blood of Christ.
Know that Jesus is our peace.
Know that in Christ, Jews and Gentiles both become one.
Know that Jesus has destroyed all barriers that once separated Jews and Gentiles.
Know that the crucified flesh of Jesus has abolished all hatred between Jews and Gentiles in Christ.
Know that the crucified flesh of Jesus has abolished the Jewish ceremonial law for those in Christ.
Know that in Christ, Jews and Gentiles are both made into the same new creation thereby making peace.
Know that what we are now in Christ is in direct contrast to what we used to be when we were far from God.
Know that Jesus has reconciled both Jews and Gentiles to God in His body by the cross.
Know that Jesus has ended the hatred between Jews and Gentiles in His body by the cross.
Know that Jesus came and proclaimed peace to both Gentiles and Jews.
Know that God is a peace maker and healer of division.
Know that in Christ, both Jews and Gentiles have acceptance and relationship with the Father by the same Holy Spirit.
Know that in Christ, Gentiles are no longer strangers to the covenants of promise.
Know that in Christ, Gentiles are no longer foreigners alienated from the commonwealth of Israel.
Know that in Christ, both Jews and Gentiles are fellow citizens with the saints and of the household of God.
Know that we (and our faith) are built upon the firm foundation laid by the apostles and prophets because Jesus Christ Himself is the chief corner stone.
Know that we were uniquely crafted in Christ to fit precisely into the growing building which is the Lord’s holy temple.
Know that Jews and Gentiles are being built together in Christ for the habitation of God through the Holy Spirit.
Know that God’s Holy Spirit dwells within us.
Know that God is building a holy temple in which to dwell through the Holy Spirit using the saints as the individual building blocks.
